html: Gluru is a tech startup with an app that provides a smart way to find and organise files, collaborate with people & teams and enhance workflow efficiency. Having already produced an Andorid app, the Gluru team wanted to offer a responsive web app to provide enhanced features to both desktop and mobile users. I was recruited to build the html & css for the user interface. I worked closely with the graphic designer to convert of the newly designed multiple psd files into a working prototype with production-ready html & css code. I employed a modular approach to SASS authoring based on a customised version of BEM methodology to build the various components of the app, abstracting components to their most basic function keeping file size to a minimum whilst maximising scalability and efficiency. Initially a six week contract, the position was extended to 3 months. Company investors then changed focus leading to a requirement for another Angular specialist to continue.

Contracted to retro-fit responsive web design (RWD) into ellaskitchen.co.uk. I was responsible for detailed analysis of custom WordPress theme templates, UX design, HTML and CSS structure to identify design patterns and develop solutions to display content effectively as the viewport size decreased, preserving the ‘hand-drawn’ design style on tablet & mobile devices. I converted the existing vanilla CSS to SCSS and developed mixins to optimise CSS generation for use within media queries; automated asset creation using Photoshop; wrote basic jQuery scripts to avoid WordPress template modification before re-platforming and participated in the successful deployment of the new code. The contract was extended for six weeks and I worked alongside the dev team to build new content including campaigns to promote healthy snacks and recycling involving extensive use of sprite sheets, jQuery UI components and a modular workflow using Grunt and Bower. Throughout this contract I developed my knowledge of Git via the terminal and gained more experience working with Grunt.

Contracted to build the Sky Sports Big Ideas competition website (http://www1.skysports.com/bigideas). Working alongside a JavaScript developer, I was responsible for producing the HTML and CSS. I used SCSS to process the CSS; Photoshop to extract image assets from multiple complex layered PSD files and wrote basic jQuery scripts to allow the user to interact with the UI and perform basic form validation.

Initially a two month contract to build the Old Mout Cider UK website, a sub-brand of Heineken. My role involved working closely with the design team, back & front-end developers and dev-ops to plan, build, test and deploy the website. The site needed to be viewed on desktop and mobile so I selected the Foundation 5 framework to provide a useful starting point for the mobile-first responsive, fluid layout. I used Sass to manage the complex CSS media queries and worked alongside another front-end developer to add progressive enhancement to the UX using jQuery. The contract was extended when a competition linked with the Old Mout UK Facebook site was required. I was also involved on other projects including working with a Java developer to convert the KFC UK website contact form to post data to external REST API methods. My role at Fabric involved daily ‘stand-ups’ and interaction with all members of the development team though which I gained experience working in an agile environment on large-scale projects. I also gained experience working with issue tracking tools (JIRA), source control (git, BitBucket/GitHub), cross browser/device/OS testing (browser dev tools, SauceLabs, BrowserStack, virtual machines, iOS & Android emulators) and modern development workflow tools including Bower & Grunt.

Responsible for implementation of creative & technical strategy, front-end development, all aspects of website design, IA/ID/UI/UX and design for print including research, planning, design, development & deployment of corporate website hyve.com and customer portal throughout multiple re-designs and re-structures over a 10 yr period. Full life-cycle of customer websites (from brief to build) during earlier stages of company evolution. Research of corporate presence within the cloud industry, competitor analysis, product development, SEO/SEM research & implementation, design and development of marketing/exhibitor material & strategies.

Director & Co-founder
Gained extensive understanding and experience of business start-up through to successful development of well-placed industry leader within the cloud hosting sector over a 10 year period. Responsible for identifying, achieving and maintaining ISO 27001 accreditation, developing internal policies & procedures, organising and conducting internal & external audits, managing front-office accounts, customer account management, staff training & management and ensuring that the highest standards of administrative processes and corporate governance were both promoted and maintained so that the business operated efficiently and in accordance with statutory and legal provisions. Providing feedback to colleagues and directors on administrative, security and financial matters, maintaining statutory books i.e. registers of directors and company officers.

Contracted by this digital agency based in Richmond to build their corporate website and accompanying CD ROM. A ‘space station’ concept was developed with several interactive modules representing the various sectors of the group. Working closely with the design layouts from the creative team, I developed a unique, highly interactive UI/UX in Flash MX that could be explored and deconstructed. The majority of animation was scripted resulting in smaller file sizes and an increase in scalability. Following completion, my contract was extended and I continued to work on various other agency web design and development projects including TDK systems & Kingston Communications.

Contracted as team leader to develop interactive training material for CitiDirect, Citibank’s premier online banking system. Following 3 years developing CitiDirect and migrating legacy systems, innovative, interactive training software was required to replace current outdated material to encourage Citibank’s customers to ‘self-train’, drastically reducing the cost of current ‘one-on-one’ training. The brief was to design and develop a system for delivery both by CD ROM and online. I designed the information architecture to be driven by XML files that customise all menus, regions, products and languages. This approach is scalable and easy to customise by non-skilled personnel. I designed the content in the form of modular, animated procedures derived from screen cams taken from the CitiDirect software. The system was partnered with comprehensive PDF guides which I designed and produced in QuarkXPress. As team leader, my responsibilities included the recruitment and management of two Flash developers and two desktop publishers.

The high demand from Kysen’s print-based clients for web content saw the creation of Kysen New Media. I transferred to the new media section and quickly discovered a passion for front-end web development, especially Flash. Working closely with the creative team, I was responsible for front-end development of the Kysen group website and various other client sites and gained experience in advanced Flash ActionScript & animations, UI/UX, HTML & CSS, database-driven content and cross browser development.

Recruited as junior designer, I soon discovered an interest in print production and was promoted to senior artworker. My skills were quickly honed by the exceptionally high standards maintained by this London based design consultancy, and I was promoted to production manager within an 18 month period. I developed advanced expertise in professional desktop publishing techniques using QuarkXpress, Adobe Photoshop & Illustrator. I was responsible for management of the production department with a team of 2 artworkers, working closely with the creative team to prepare complex print jobs for production. I was also responsible for high-end re-touching, editing and complex image composition & manipulation in Photoshop.
